title: Build Belowground Desert Shelter
brief: Construct a belowground shelter in desert conditions to reduce midday temperatures by 16-22Â°C (30-40Â°F).
steps: Step 1: Find a low spot or depression between dunes or rocks for your shelter location.
Step 2: Dig a trench 45-60 centimeters deep, long and wide enough to lie in comfortably.
Step 3: Pile sand from the trench to form a mound around three sides of the opening.
Step 4: Dig out additional sand on the open end to create easy entrance/exit access.
Step 5: Cover the trench with available material (poncho, canvas, parachute).
Step 6: Secure covering material using sand, rocks, or other weights.
Step 7: If extra material available, create second layer 30-45 centimeters above first cover for additional 11-22Â°C temperature reduction.
warnings: Build this shelter before the heat of day as physical effort increases dehydration.
Ensure adequate ventilation to prevent suffocation.
Double-layer construction significantly improves temperature reduction but requires more materials.
